result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J. Seefeldt

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 18, 2023 at 09:30 am.

3:12 PM cases 20CM1056, 21CM434, 21CF632, 22CF710 called. Defendant Thomas J. Seefeldt in court.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for Thomas J. Seefeldt.  Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
In 22CF710: Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver. 
All files are referred to Branch 5 for 20CM1056 with all other files tracking along. Matters to be scheduled for a status conference.

Cases called at 10:58 AM: 20CM1056, 21CF632, 21CM434, 22CF710.
Defendant Thomas J. Seefeldt in court with Attorney Ryan J. Moertel. Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense Motion to Suppress based on lack of Miranda warnings. State calls Detective Tom Xiong of the ECPD. He is sworn and testifies. Detective Xiong identifies the Defendant in the courtroom.
Cross examination by Defense. Re-Direct by State. State offers Exhibit #1. Exhibit #1 is admitted. Witness is excused. 
Counsel argues the Motion to Suppress.  Court finds that the Officer starts investigative detention, but it did not turn into a custodial situation therefore,  Miranda is not required. Motion denied.
All cases to ride along with 22CF710 for a Preliminary Hearing on 10/18/22 at 2:30 PM. Branch 5 to schedule further following the Preliminary Hearing.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

3:58 PM Cases called: 20CM1056, 21CF632, 21CM434 & 22CF710. Defendant Thomas J. Seefeldt in court.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for Thomas J. Seefeldt.  Attorney Andrew Gunderson in court for State of Wisconsin. There is not an agreement in these cases. 
Defense has filed a Motion to Suppress in 20CM1056 and requests a Motion Hearing. Motion Hearing: 10/12/22 at 11am
State requests a Preliminary Hearing in 22CF710 for 10/18/22 at 2:30pm
All files will continue to travel together at this point.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
Defendant on house arrest at 1439 Altoona Ave. Eau Claire, WI 54701 unless working or attending therapy.
Defendant can work 6:45am - 7:00pm.
No guests allowed at defendant's residence except: Adam Fouts, Wayne Seefeldt, Sandy Seefeldt, or Elliott Seefeldt.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting.
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

Defendant can work 6:45am - 7:00pm.
No guests allowed at defendant's residence except: Adam Fouts, Wayne Seefeldt, Sandy Seefeldt, or Elliott Seefeldt.

10:03 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Thomas J. Seefeldt in court, in custody.  Attorney Ryan J. Moertel in court for Thomas J. Seefeldt. 
State objects to any bond modification. Court has a colloquy with Attorney Moertel regarding Huber in other matters in which the defendant has already been sentenced. 
State renews objection and makes an argument for Court to deny the Defense's request for a bond modification. Court modifies cash bond from $10,000 cash bond to $1,000 cash bond with conditions. 
Parties and the Court discuss the residence alleged as the drug trafficking. Matter is to be scheduled in Branch 5 with defendant's other pending matters on 9/14/22 at 4:00 PM.
Seefeldt's Notice of Motion and Motion to Modify Bond

to Dismiss Counts 1 and 2 of the Criminal Complaint.
Based upon the State's Motion to Dismiss, Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine and Count 2- Possession of THC [2nd+ Offense] of the criminal complaint, are hereby dismissed without prejudice.
